entry.et: Middle English spede, from Old English spēd; akin to Old High German spuot prosperity, speed, Old English spōwan to succeed, Latin spes hope, Lithuanian spėti to be in time

def.dt: :prosperity in an undertaking :success
:the act or state of moving swiftly :swiftness
:rate of motion: as
:velocity 1
:the magnitude of a velocity irrespective of direction
:impetus
:swiftness or rate of performance or action :velocity 3a
:the sensitivity of a photographic film, plate, or paper expressed numerically
:the light-gathering power of a lens or optical system
:the time during which a camera shutter is open
:a transmission gear in automotive vehicles or bicycles usually used in combination a ten-speed bicycle
:someone or something that appeals to one's taste just my speed
:methamphetamine
:a related stimulant drug and especially an amphetamine
:fast rapidly
:operating at full effectiveness or potential
:to prosper in an undertaking
:get along fare
:to make haste sped to her bedside
:to go or drive at excessive or illegal speed
:to move, work, or take place faster :accelerate the heart speeds up
:to cause or help to prosper :aid
:to further the success of
:to cause to move quickly :hasten
:to wish Godspeed to
:to increase the speed of :accelerate
:to send out speed an arrow
:a low raised ridge across a roadway (as in a parking lot) to limit vehicle speed
:an event at which each participant converses individually with all the prospective partners for a few minutes in order to select those with whom dates are desired
:a telephone function by which a selected stored number can be dialed by pressing only one key
:one who habitually misuses amphetamines and especially methamphetamine
:the maximum or minimum speed permitted by law in a given area under specified circumstances

:a fundamental physical constant that is the speed at which electromagnetic radiation propagates in a vacuum and that has a value fixed by international convention of 299,792,458 meters per second symbol c
:a method of reading rapidly by skimming
:a shop that sells custom automotive equipment especially to hot-rodders
